de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing

Class OnlineHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing.AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler
      • de.upb.t2t.control.database.editing.OnlineHandler

  • public class OnlineHandler
extends AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler

    An implementation of the AbstractDatabaseEditingHandler that provides online editing functionality. Its reloadDatabase() method can be employed by any user to overwrite the local database with the latest version provided by the database server. More importantly, however, this class's functions also enable authorised users, i.e. those who can produce valid login credentials, to contribute to the online database. In order to do so, every little step of editation, for example adding a new TranscriptionItem, will be communicated instantly to the server, sending the currently stored LoginCredentials along every time.

    With this class employing a singleton pattern, its instance can be obtained by calling getInstance().

    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    OfflineHandler, MainController.getLoginCredentials()

      • reloadDatabase

        public void reloadDatabase()
        This method should be called in order to get the latest version of the online database. It makes sure that there will not be two or more update processes taking place at the same time.

      • postServerRequest

      • isAuthenticationConfirmed

        public boolean isAuthenticationConfirmed()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        A convencience getter to quickly check, whether the currently held LoginCredentials are valid. This function should for example be called at least once prior to opening the EditDatabaseDialogue to make sure the user does not waste their time editing the database when they actually are not allowed to do so.
        Returns:
        true if the LoginCredentials are valid; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        MainController.getLoginCredentials()

      • getURLConnectionToServer

        private java.net.URLConnection getURLConnectionToServer()
                                                 throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                        java.io.IOException
        A convenience function that opens a new connection to the database server.
        Returns:
        a URLConnection object able to communicate with the server.
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if URL.URL(String) throws one.
        java.io.IOException - of URL.openConnection() throws one.

      • getStringBuilderWithCredentials

        private java.lang.StringBuilder getStringBuilderWithCredentials(java.lang.String method)
                                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        A convenience function to instantiate a new StringBuilder object that has already been fed the user's login credentials and the method that should be invoked on the server (e.g. ADD_TRANS_ITEM.
        Parameters:
